history.content: You are an intelligent assistant. You always provide well-reasoned answers that are both correct and helpful. You always use Markdown formatting when replying with code.

The sky appears blue because of a phenomenon called Rayleigh scattering. As sunlight enters Earth's atmosphere, it is scattered, or deflected, in all directions by molecules and small particles in the air. Blue light is scattered more than other colors because it travels in smaller, shorter waves. This scattered blue light is what we see when we look up at the sky.
